content.question: The diagram above represents the forces exerted on a box that a child is holding. <math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the force applied by the child’s hand, and <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the weight of the box. The child begins to raise the box with increasing speed. Which of the following claims is correct about force <math alttext="F sub h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> that is exerted by the box on the child’s hand as the box is being raised?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub h, equals F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not change as the child raises the box.

<math alttext="F sub h, equals F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger as the box is being raised than when it was being held.

<math alttext="F sub h, equals F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not change as the child raises the box.

<math alttext="F sub h, equals F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger as the box is being raised than when it was being held.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub h, equals F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="F sub N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is larger as the box is being raised than when it was being held.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
